edu.ncsu.csc316.customer_service.manager

Class CustomerServiceManager

  • public class CustomerServiceManager
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages the Customers and the HelpTickets
    Author:
    someshherath

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getHelpTicketQueue()
      Retrieves the complete help ticket queue, sorted in order that the customers will be served.
      java.lang.String getPlaceInLine(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName)
      Outputs the customer's place in line in the help queue, along with the help ticket information in the format (with 2nd line indentation of 4 spaces and NO newline at the end): Bob Baker is number 3 in the queue: Priority 2 submmited on 08/14/2017 at 06:54:00: Can I change my flight?
      void removeCustomerFromQueue(java.lang.String firstName, java.lang.String lastName)
      Removes the customer from the help ticket software (for example, if the customer finds the answer to their question while waiting, they may cancel their help ticket instead of waiting to be serviced)

    • Method Detail

      • getPlaceInLine

        public java.lang.String getPlaceInLine(java.lang.String firstName,
                                       java.lang.String lastName)
        Outputs the customer's place in line in the help queue, along with the help ticket information in the format (with 2nd line indentation of 4 spaces and NO newline at the end): Bob Baker is number 3 in the queue: Priority 2 submmited on 08/14/2017 at 06:54:00: Can I change my flight?
        Parameters:
        firstName - - the customer's first name
        lastName - - the customer's last name
        Returns:
        the customer's place in line and help ticket information

      • getHelpTicketQueue

        public java.lang.String getHelpTicketQueue()
        Retrieves the complete help ticket queue, sorted in order that the customers will be served. Higher priority is served first, and (if priorities are the same) the help ticket with the earlier submission timestamp is serviced first. The help queue is returned in the following format (with indentation of 4 spaces and NO newline at the very end): Priority 8: submitted at 11/11/2017 23:45:00 by John Smith, Question: How much does it cost to change flights on the same day? Priority 5: submitted at 09/03/2017 10:00:00 by Suzanne Smith, Question: How do I check my mileage balance? Priority 2: submitted at 10/14/2017 06:54:00 by Bob Baker, Question: Can I change my flight?
        Returns:
        the help ticket queue listed in the order customers will be serviced

      • removeCustomerFromQueue

        public void removeCustomerFromQueue(java.lang.String firstName,
                                    java.lang.String lastName)
        Removes the customer from the help ticket software (for example, if the customer finds the answer to their question while waiting, they may cancel their help ticket instead of waiting to be serviced)
        Parameters:
        firstName - - the customer's first named
        lastName - - the customer's last name
